pullRequest.title: Issue #11619: The CSR subject attributes (c,st,l,o,ou,cn) will now be…
pullRequest.bodyText:
… set in a single attribute - subjectDN.
fixes #11619

nodes.bodyText:
The ''cn'' relative distinguished name type, if defined, is required to be first and must be one of the defined domains. If not defined, the first defined domain will be used.

"defined domains" -defined where/by what?

Not sure this is technically correct but here's a suggested edit as a starting point:
Subject distinguished name (DN) to use for the certificate. The DN can include the following relative distinguished name (RDN) types: ''cn'', ''c'', ''st'', ''l'', ''o'' and ''ou''. If the ''cn'' relative distinguished name type is defined, it must be one of the defined domains and it must be the first RDN in the ''subjectDN'' configuration attribute. If this name type is not defined, the first defined domain is used as the the subject distinguished name.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -25,23 +25,8 @@ domain.desc=A domain name to request a certificate for.
 validFor=Valid for
 validFor.desc=The duration of time that the certificate signing request specifies for the certificate to be valid. The default is defined by the ACME CA server.
 
-country=Country
-country.desc=Country name to use for the certificate.
-
-state=State or province
-state.desc=State or province name to use for the certificate.
-
-locality=Locality
-locality.desc=Locality name to use for the certificate.
-
-organization=Organization
-organization.desc=Organization name to use for the certificate.
-
-organizationalUnit=Organizational unit
-organizationalUnit.desc=Organizational unit name to use for the certificate.
-
-acceptTermsOfService=Accept terms of service
-acceptTermsOfService.desc=Indicates whether the user accepts the terms of service for the ACME CA server. If true, the terms of service are automatically accepted. If false, and the ACME CA server issues terms of service, the request for a certificate fails.  
+subjectDN=Subject distinguished name
+subjectDN.desc=Subject distinguished name to use for the certificate. The DN may include the following relative distinguished name types: ''cn'', ''c'', ''st'', ''l'', ''o'' and ''ou''. The ''cn'' relative distinguished name type, if defined, is required to be first and must be one of the defined domains. If not defined, the first defined domain will be used.

nodes.bodyText:
change
The DN ''subjectDN'' ({0}) contains a ''cn'' relative distinguished name (RDN) value ({1}) that does not match any of the defined domains.
to
The ''{0}'' distinguished name (DN) ''subjectDN'' contains a ''{1}'' ''cn'' relative distinguished name (RDN) value  that does not match any of the defined domains.
are ({double brackets}) required? If not, use {single curly brackets} for variables.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -177,3 +177,27 @@ CWPKI2037E.useraction=Provide at least one non-null, non-empty domain in the con
 CWPKI2038W=CWPKI2038W: The ACME service was unable to revoke the certificate with serial number {0}. The error is ''{1}.''
 CWPKI2038W.explanation=The ACME service attempted to revoke the certificate, but was unable to.
 CWPKI2038W.useraction=Review the error message for details on the failure. The certificate will need to be revoked manually.
+
+CWPKI2039E=CWPKI2039E: The DN ''subjectDN'' ({0}) contains a ''cn'' relative distinguished name (RDN) value ({1}) that does not match any of the defined domains.

nodes.bodyText:
change
The ACME service installed a certificate with serial number {0} that is signed by the ACME certificate authority at the {1} URI. The expiration date is {2}.
to
The ACME service installed a certificate with a {0} serial number that is signed by the ACME certificate authority at the {1} URI. The expiration date is {2}.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -50,7 +50,7 @@ CWPKI2006I=CWPKI2006I: The ACME certificate authority at the {0} URI provided th
 CWPKI2006I.explanation=The certificate authority provides terms of service.
 CWPKI2006I.useraction= Review the provided terms of service.
 
-CWPKI2007I=CWPKI2007I: The ACME service installed a certificate that is signed by the ACME certificate authority at the {0} URI. The expiration date is {1}.
+CWPKI2007I=CWPKI2007I: The ACME service installed a certificate with serial number {0} that is signed by the ACME certificate authority at the {1} URI. The expiration date is {2}.

nodes.bodyText:
change
Provide a ''subjectDN'' attribute value with a ''cn'' RDN value that matches one of the defined domains or does not have the ''cn'' RDN included.
to
Provide a ''subjectDN'' attribute value with a ''cn'' RDN value that matches one of the defined domains. Alternatively,  provide a ''subjectDN'' attribute value that does not include the ''cn'' RDN value
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -177,3 +177,27 @@ CWPKI2037E.useraction=Provide at least one non-null, non-empty domain in the con
 CWPKI2038W=CWPKI2038W: The ACME service was unable to revoke the certificate with serial number {0}. The error is ''{1}.''
 CWPKI2038W.explanation=The ACME service attempted to revoke the certificate, but was unable to.
 CWPKI2038W.useraction=Review the error message for details on the failure. The certificate will need to be revoked manually.
+
+CWPKI2039E=CWPKI2039E: The DN ''subjectDN'' ({0}) contains a ''cn'' relative distinguished name (RDN) value ({1}) that does not match any of the defined domains.
+CWPKI2039E.explanation= The ''cn'' RDN must match one of the defined domains.
+CWPKI2039E.useraction=Provide a ''subjectDN'' attribute value with a ''cn'' RDN value that matches one of the defined domains or does not have the ''cn'' RDN included.

nodes.bodyText:
change
If the ''cn'' RDN is defined in the ''subjectDN'' configuration attribute, then it must be the first RDN.
to
If the ''cn'' RDN is defined, it must be the first RDN  in the ''subjectDN'' configuration attribute.

nodes.bodyText:
change
Provide a ''subjectDN'' attribute value that either defines the ''cn'' attribute as the first RDN, or does not define the ''cn'' attribute as an RDN. If it is not defined, the first defined domain will be used.
To
Provide a ''subjectDN'' attribute value that either defines the ''cn'' attribute as the first RDN, or does not the ''cn'' attribute. If the ''cn'' attribute is not defined, the first defined domain is used as the subject distinguished name.

beforeCommit.message: Issue #11619: The CSR subject attributes (c,st,l,o,ou,cn) will now be set in a single attribute - subjectDN.

afterCommit.message: Issue #11619: The CSR subject attributes (c,st,l,o,ou,cn) will now be set in a single attribute - subjectDN.

beforeCommit.message: Issue #11619: The CSR subject attributes (c,st,l,o,ou,cn) will now be set in a single attribute - subjectDN.

afterCommit.message: Issue #11619: The CSR subject attributes (c,st,l,o,ou,cn) will now be set in a single attribute - subjectDN.

nodes.bodyText:
change to
Provide either a subjectDN attribute value with a cn RDN value that matches one of the defined domains or a subjectDN attribute value that does not have the cn RDN included.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -177,3 +177,27 @@ CWPKI2037E.useraction=Provide at least one non-null, non-empty domain in the con
 CWPKI2038W=CWPKI2038W: The ACME service was unable to revoke the certificate with serial number {0}. The error is ''{1}.''
 CWPKI2038W.explanation=The ACME service attempted to revoke the certificate, but was unable to.
 CWPKI2038W.useraction=Review the error message for details on the failure. The certificate will need to be revoked manually.
+
+CWPKI2039E=CWPKI2039E: The ''{0}'' distinguished name (DN) defined by subjectDN contains a ''{1}'' cn relative distinguished name (RDN) value that does not match any of the defined domains.
+CWPKI2039E.explanation=The cn RDN must match one of the defined domains.
+CWPKI2039E.useraction=Provide a subjectDN attribute value with a cn RDN value that matches one of the defined domains or does not have the cn RDN included.

nodes.bodyText: Can you give any info about what constitutes a valid RDN? The user action should offer more than just "see error message", which is a given.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -177,3 +177,27 @@ CWPKI2037E.useraction=Provide at least one non-null, non-empty domain in the con
 CWPKI2038W=CWPKI2038W: The ACME service was unable to revoke the certificate with serial number {0}. The error is ''{1}.''
 CWPKI2038W.explanation=The ACME service attempted to revoke the certificate, but was unable to.
 CWPKI2038W.useraction=Review the error message for details on the failure. The certificate will need to be revoked manually.
+
+CWPKI2039E=CWPKI2039E: The ''{0}'' distinguished name (DN) defined by subjectDN contains a ''{1}'' cn relative distinguished name (RDN) value that does not match any of the defined domains.
+CWPKI2039E.explanation=The cn RDN must match one of the defined domains.
+CWPKI2039E.useraction=Provide a subjectDN attribute value with a cn RDN value that matches one of the defined domains or does not have the cn RDN included.
+
+CWPKI2040E=CWPKI2040E: The cn relative distinguished name (RDN) was not the first RDN in the subjectDN configuration attribute.
+CWPKI2040E.explanation=If the cn RDN is defined, it must be the first RDN in the subjectDN configuration attribute.
+CWPKI2040E.useraction=Provide a subjectDN attribute value that either defines the cn attribute as the first RDN, or does not contain the cn attribute. If the cn attribute is not defined, the first defined domain is used as the cn RDN value.
+
+CWPKI2041E=CWPKI2041E: The ''{0}'' relative distinguished name (RDN) type in the subjectDN configuration attribute is not supported. The following RDN types are supported: cn, o, ou, c, st, l.
+CWPKI2041E.explanation=The subjectDN attribute value contains an RDN that is not supported.
+CWPKI2041E.useraction=Provide a subjectDN attribute value that does not contain unsupported RDN types. The following RDN types are supported: cn, o, ou, c, st, l.
+
+CWPKI2042E=CWPKI2042E: The ''{0}'' subjectDN attribute value is not a valid distinguished name. The error is ''{1}''.
+CWPKI2042E.explanation=The subjectDN attribute must be a valid distinguished name.
+CWPKI2042E.useraction=Provide a valid distinguished name as the subjectDN attribute value.
+
+CWPKI2043E=CWPKI2043E: The ''{0}'' value is not a valid relative distinguished name (RDN). The error is ''{1}''.
+CWPKI2043E.explanation=The ACME service was not able to create an RDN from the specified value.
+CWPKI2043E.useraction=Review the error message for details on the failure.

nodes.bodyText:
change
Verify that the certificate chain is comprised of X.509 certificates and try again.
to
Ensure that all the certificates in the certificate chain are X.509 certificates and try again.

+CWPKI2044E=CWPKI2044E: The certificate is not an X.509 certificate. The certificate type is {0}.
+CWPKI2044E.explanation=The ACME service expects all certificates in the certificate chain to be X.509 certificates.
+CWPKI2044E.useraction=Verify that the certificate chain is comprised of X.509 certificates and try again.

nodes.bodyText: If the cn RDN value is included in the DN, it must match one of the defined domains.
